column2: sailer5373, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Gemfibrozil (600MG)for approx. 1 month, along with Simvastatin (80MG)but usually took them separately.  On the morning of Sept 2, 2012, I took the two medications together. Approximately 2 hrs.later I started to flush and sweat profusely,and suffered from severe pain and burning in the upper abdomen and was rushed to the hospital.  I spent 4 days in the hospital with diarrhea, and diagnosed with panchreatitis. No warning was given to me about the interaction between these two drugs. I asked my pharmacist afterward if there had been any bad reactions to the combination of these two drugs and he told me they could have deadly results if taken together.

column1: High Amount of Triglyceride in the Blood
column2: jimbo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: When I was employed and had health insurance my doctor tried me on a couple of prescriptions to reduce my over 800 tryglycerides Lipitors and others did not work or caused issues with my liver eventually we found Vytorin worked without any issues. But once I was unemployed and could no longer afford health insurance - Vytorin cost me over $100/month. Due to cost I stopped using Vytorin. On the internet I found out Vytorin would provide it prescription free for financially challenged people but my doctor would not sign the paperwork. I found a new doctor who first gave me a free months supply vytorin. He then researched and determined Gemfibrozil would also solve high Tryglyceride.  Gemfibrozil is only $17 for a 90 day supply (A savings of $283 over 3 months). I usually take the pill just before eating my breakfast and dinner as I don't recall (or have time) to take the pill 30 minutes prior to eating. My new doctor says it is a great success as it reduced my tryglicerides from over 800 to 82. I also take daily a multi vitamin and two 1000 mg omega-3 fish oil soft gels. I have been taking the pill for more than 6 months. There has been a loss in sex drive but prior to reading the other comments I would blame said loss from the stress and depression of being underemployed or unemployed for almost 2 years.
